title: MAG 122 - Zombie Transcript
text:
able to read this, that you won’t simply stare blankly at this page 
before performing your response, your artificial opinion. There is every chance 
that I am the only one left, and the whole world has fallen to a soulless horde, 
devoid of life and feeling. Even so, thank you for pretending to care. 
ARCHIVIST 
Statement ends. 
(The Archivist exhales; his voice is sounding stronger) Well, that certainly 
helped, I think. No notes or follow-up in the statement and obviously no 
research done into it by myself or, uh... my team. I think we can safely say that 
Ms. St John is not the only real person left in the world, though, whatever she 
might be doing now. And whatever might be with her. 

The Magnus Archives – 122 – Zombie 
 
17 
 
It can be hard, though, sometimes, other, other people. Feelings. I-I’m trying to 
focus, trying to make sure I’m the same me as before, but how can anyone 
really remember that? How do you know you’re the same person that went to 
sleep? (The Archivist sighs) 
[Knocking on door] 
Yes, I’m... I’m done. 
[Door opens] 
ARCHIVIST 
(Sighs) Georgie, is she, uh...? 
BASIRA 
She’s gone. Didn’t see where. 
ARCHIVIST 
No, I, I wouldn’t’ve, uh... Probably for the best. 
BASIRA 
Yeah. 
… 
Better? 
ARCHIVIST 
Yes. Yes, thank you. 

The Magnus Archives – 122 – Zombie 
 
18 
 
BASIRA 
Right. Then I’ve got questions. 
ARCHIVIST 
So do I. 
BASIRA 
Me first. What are you? 
ARCHIVIST 
Honestly, I don’t know. I don’t feel... inhuman, or… I want to say I’m the same, 
but I don’t really know if that’s true. I know I’m different. I feel... more real, 
somehow. 
BASIRA 
So, what does that actually mean? 
ARCHIVIST 
Probably nothing good. 
My turn. What… what happened to me? 
BASIRA 
How much do remember? 
ARCHIVIST 
I don’t... 

The Magnus Archives – 122 – Zombie 
 
19 
 
Music. Everything was wrong. Gertrude was there and then... dancing? I think? 
Then… pain, and I was somewhere else. Dreaming. 
BASIRA 
Dreaming? 
ARCHIVIST 
Yes. 
You’re sure about Tim? 
BASIRA 
Yeah, they, um… they found his remains a few days later. 
ARCHIVIST 
And Daisy? 
BASIRA 
They still haven’t found her body. Probably never will. I thought for a while she 
might, um... But it’s been months. She’s gone. 
ARCHIVIST 
Just you and me. And Melanie and Martin, I-I guess. Honestly, I’m surprised 
Martin isn’t... 
(Basira sighs) 
What? Oh, go— The, the plan. Did— Martin, is, is he okay? 

The Magnus Archives – 122 – Zombie 
 
20 
 
What did Elias do? 
BASIRA 
No, nothing. Elias isn’t the problem. 
ARCHIVIST 
So— What? 
BASIRA 
Elias is locked up. 
ARCHIVIST 
Wait, Martin’s plan worked? 
BASIRA 
Yeah, a bunch of sectioned officers took him in. He made some sort of deal, I 
think, but he’s not getting out any time soon. 
ARCHIVIST 
Oh. Wow, okay. Great. So, what’s the problem? 
BASIRA 
He appointed an interim director. Guy named Peter Lukas. 
ARCHIVIST 
Oh. 
BASIRA 

The Magnus Archives – 122 – Zombie 
 
21 
 
Yeah. 
ARCHIVIST 
Read about him. 
BASIRA 
Yeah, I hunted down some of those old statements and... yeah. 
ARCHIVIST 
(Darkly) What did he do to Martin? 
BASIRA 
I... don’t know. We don’t see him around the Archives much these days. Best I 
can figure, he’s working on something with Lukas. 
ARCHIVIST 
No. No that, that... No. There must be something else. 
BASIRA 
Maybe. I don’t know. 
ARCHIVIST 
And Melanie? 
BASIRA 
A lot’s happened, while you’ve been gone. 
ARCHIVIST 

The Magnus Archives – 122 – Zombie 
 
22 
 
Right. 
Well, I guess we should probably let one of the nurses know I’m awake. I’m 
sure they have all sorts of tests to do, make sure I’m not a zombie or a… 
… 
I don’t suppose you brought in any clothes? 
BASIRA 
No, I just, you know, grabbed that statement on my way out. 
ARCHIVIST 
Right, well uh, I kept some in the Archives, uh, in my office. 
BASIRA 
Yeah, those got, um... We had to throw those out. 
ARCHIVIST 
What? 
BASIRA 
Like I said, a lot’s happened. 
ARCHIVIST 
S-Since I’ve been… Fine. 
BASIRA 
I’ll get you some new ones. Better ones.
